DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Peripheral Motor Neuropathy Classification Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale from a method of generalization an unfavorable inflammation of the peripheral motor nerves.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Peripheral Motor Neuropathy Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a method of generalization any unfavorable inflammation of the peripheral motor nerves.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Inflammation or degeneration of the peripheral motor nerves.:A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation or degeneration of the peripheral motor nerves.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale of an unfavorable inflammation of the peripheral motor nerves.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade 3: Unable to perform fine motor tasks (buttoning shirt, coloring, writing or drawing, using eating utensils) or unable to ambulate without assistance.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Grade 3: Unable to perform fine motor tasks (buttoning shirt, coloring, writing or drawing, using eating utensils) or unable to ambulate without assistance.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade 3: Unable to perform fine motor tasks (buttoning shirt, coloring, writing or drawing, using eating utensils) or unable to ambulate without assistance.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade 2: Weakness that alters fine motor skills (buttoning shirt, coloring, writing or drawing, using eating utensils) or gait without abrogating ability to perform these tasks.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Grade 2: Weakness that alters fine motor skills (buttoning shirt, coloring, writing or drawing, using eating utensils) or gait without abrogating ability to perform these tasks.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade 2: Weakness that alters fine motor skills (buttoning shirt, coloring, writing or drawing, using eating utensils) or gait without abrogating ability to perform these tasks.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade 1: Subjective weakness, but no deficits detected on neurological exam, other than abnormal deep tendon reflexes.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Grade 1: Subjective weakness, but no deficits detected on neurological exam, other than abnormal deep tendon reflexes.
